segment.source: You can have centralized control over Enterprise Mode by creating a single, global XML site list that includes the list of websites to render using Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: You can have centralized control over Enterprise Mode by creating a single, global XML site list that includes the list of websites to render using Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: Check for a new Enterprise Mode site list xml file (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Check for a new Enterprise Mode site list xml file (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Check for a new Enterprise Mode site list xml file
segment.target: Check for a new Enterprise Mode site list xml file

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)

segment.source: You can have centralized control over Enterprise Mode by creating a single, global XML site list that includes the list of websites to render using Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: You can have centralized control over Enterprise Mode by creating a single, global XML site list that includes the list of websites to render using Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: You can add and remove sites from your XML list as frequently as you want, changing which sites should render in Enterprise Mode for your employees.
segment.target: You can add and remove sites from your XML list as frequently as you want, changing which sites should render in Enterprise Mode for your employees.

segment.source: For information about turning on Enterprise Mode and using site lists, see Turn on Enterprise Mode and use a site list.
segment.target: For information about turning on Enterprise Mode and using site lists, see Turn on Enterprise Mode and use a site list.

segment.source: The information in this topic only covers HTTP protocol.
segment.target: The information in this topic only covers HTTP protocol.

segment.source: We strongly recommend that you use HTTP protocol instead of file protocol due to increased performance.
segment.target: We strongly recommend that you use HTTP protocol instead of file protocol due to increased performance.

segment.source: How Internet Explorer 11 looks for an updated site list
segment.target: How Internet Explorer 11 looks for an updated site list

segment.source: Internet Explorer starts up and looks for an updated site list in the following places:
segment.target: Internet Explorer starts up and looks for an updated site list in the following places:

segment.source: In the cache container.
segment.target: In the cache container.

segment.source: IE first checks the cache container to see if it finds your XML site list.
segment.target: IE first checks the cache container to see if it finds your XML site list.

segment.source: In the local cache.
segment.target: In the local cache.

segment.source: If there’s nothing in the cache container, IE checks your local cache for the site list.
segment.target: If there’s nothing in the cache container, IE checks your local cache for the site list.

segment.source: On the server.
segment.target: On the server.

segment.source: Based on standard IE caching rules, IE might look for a copy of your site list in the location you put specified in the SiteList value of the registry.
segment.target: Based on standard IE caching rules, IE might look for a copy of your site list in the location you put specified in the SiteList value of the registry.

segment.source: If there’s an .xml file in the cache container, IE waits 65 seconds and then checks the local cache for a newer version of the file from the server, based on standard caching rules.
segment.target: If there’s an .xml file in the cache container, IE waits 65 seconds and then checks the local cache for a newer version of the file from the server, based on standard caching rules.

segment.source: If the server file has a different version number than the version in the cache container, the server file is used and stored in the cache container.
segment.target: If the server file has a different version number than the version in the cache container, the server file is used and stored in the cache container.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you’re already using a site list, enterprise mode continues to work during the 65 second wait; it just uses your existing site list instead of your new one.
segment.target: If you’re already using a site list, enterprise mode continues to work during the 65 second wait; it just uses your existing site list instead of your new one.
